body:
@sborya @prateekm 
Please take a look when you have a chance.

@prateekm @cameronlee314 I agree to @dnishimura suggestion. I can create a followup ticket to address the feedback in this PR.

Do you guys agree to checking this in?
I'm ok with fixing forward. Let's check this in if @cameronlee314 doesn't have an objection / isn't available by EOD.

> I'm ok with fixing forward. Let's check this in if @cameronlee314 doesn't have an objection / isn't available by EOD.

@shanthoosh, can you please double check that if we check this in, then Samza should still be in a working state (don't spend time doing extra testing, but maybe reread the changes one more time)? If so, then I am good to check this in and do a follow-up PR. I just want to make sure that no one else is blocked in testing other features until the follow-up gets checked in.
@PawasChhokra Merged the patch with trunk. Thanks for the changes.

Addressed all comments. 
Thumbsup => comment applied.

@cameronlee314
If there're no startpoints published, then this should be a No side-effect on SamzaContainer. 

Startpoint store is defaulted to coordinator stream. This would instantiate a coordinator-stream consumer and read all messages from the stream unnecessarily even when there're no startpoints. 

In addition to checking this in, before this feature is completed we could remove the defaults for the startpoint store.

What do you think?

Talked with @shanthoosh offline.
Looks like the reading of the coordinator stream even with no startpoints is already checked in, so this PR isn't actually adding extra operations. So we can just check this in and then do a follow-up to handle the comments on this PR and to disable reading the coordinator stream if there are no startpoints.

@cameronlee314 @prateekm 
Created this follow-up ticket: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SAMZA-2083 to track and address the review-comments from this PR.
@dnishimura Thanks for the changes. Merged this patch to trunk.
Per the discussion offline with @atoomula ,the exact behavior of supporting SET command is yet to be defined and we've agreed not to put it in this PR but leave it as a future work instead.
@atoomula @srinipunuru Could you help to review this PR?
Thanks @shanthoosh!

Discussed this with  @prateekm offline. We've agreed to get this change in. In the future we would do refactoring where in the `LocalityManager` will be managed by the `ClusterJobCoordinator` . `LocalityManager` would be passed in to `JobModelManager` when generating the `JobModel`.
@rmatharu Thanks for the patch. Merged to trunk.

@shanthoosh I did not agree to get this change in. I recommended trying to extract the locality manager as a constructor / apply parameter and passing it in from the ClusterManagerJobCoordinator first.

@rmatharu can you give that a try? Let's fix cleanly if it's not too much work.
Can you resolve the conflicts and update the PR?
Resolved the merge conflicts
@mynameborat Can you clarify what the issue is with sharing the thread pool? What's the disparity?

> @mynameborat Can you clarify what the issue is with sharing the thread pool? What's the disparity?

I added this ticket - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SAMZA-2087
let me know if you have more questions.
Followup PR: https://github.com/apache/samza/pull/897/files

@xinyuiscool @sborya 
Please take a look when you have a chance.
Thanks for the review, @srinipunuru . I've updated the PR ([5f7cb40](https://github.com/apache/samza/pull/845/commits/5f7cb40aa1674372ac06f326ce496c4c1aad3ee3)) to handle the exceptions.

@cameronlee314 @dnishimura 
Please take a look when you have a chance.
Please take a look at the comment https://github.com/apache/samza/pull/869#discussion_r246982218 regarding not having KafkaSystemConsumer directly implement StartpointVisitor.

@dxichen Thanks for the pull request. 

Just to add relevant context. We observed recurring build failures in LinkedIn build machines(not in local dev-setup, travis) due to the following exception:

```
java.lang.AssertionError: Client connection setup failed. Aborting tests..

 "java.lang.AssertionError: Client connection setup failed. Aborting tests..
at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
at org.apache.samza.zk.TestZkUtils.testSetup(TestZkUtils.java:80)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod$1.runReflectiveCall(FrameworkMethod.java:50)
at org.junit.internal.runners.model.ReflectiveCallable.run(ReflectiveCallable.java:12)
at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod.invokeExplosively(FrameworkMethod.java:47)
at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.RunBefores.evaluate(RunBefores.java:24)
at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.RunAfters.evaluate(RunAfters.java:27)
at org.junit.rules.ExpectedException$ExpectedExceptionStatement.evaluate(ExpectedException.java:239)
at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.FailOnTimeout$CallableStatement.call(FailOnTimeout.java:298)
at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.FailOnTimeout$CallableStatement.call(FailOnTimeout.java:292)
at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

```

And we verified that increasing the zookeeper client and session timeout solved this problem.
@cameronlee314 Thanks for the review. Addressed the comment.
LGTM
LGTM

@cameronlee314 This patch addresses your comment here: [#869 (comment)](https://github.com/apache/samza/pull/869#discussion_r246982218)

Please take a look when you have a chance.
Closing it, in lieu of https://github.com/apache/samza/pull/903.
Closing this in lieu of https://github.com/apache/samza/pull/912 and a follow on to that.
Addressed all comments.

> General comment not entirely related to this specific change:
> All the schemas in our tests have an outer record with primitive and complex types within it. We should also add tests with schemas containing just the primitive types or complex types (other than the record). I'm not sure if the code handles such cases.

Yup we need to support the primitive types in Samza SQL. I will open a bug to add a support for it.

@cameronlee314 
 Please take a look when you have a chance.
@vjagadish1989 @srinipunuru please have a look.

Closing this since
deciding the bound on the start of a container is non-trivial, and depends on a large number of parameters. 
Instead, we can introduce bounded-start on components such as SystemsConsumer.
Looks good
Is it possible to back-port this patch to samza internal releases done at linkedin?
Since, hot-fixes are reserved for critical bug fixes - probably not worth back-porting new features/enhancements. I'd wait for 1.0.1, since it's around the corner anyways :-)

> Right now Samza SQL AvroRelConverter transforms the records with null values into null records. I think this was added to support `select * from` usecase when the input has null records, But ideally that should be supported through a mechanism where the entire record is passed as null from input to the output rather than add a current hack where we are flattening the record with null values into null record.

While converting a null avro record to rel record on line 90 (which is for the top level root record), we are explicitly setting each field in that record to null. The reverse is done here only for the root record for symmetry. Without the change that is reverted in the review, we cannot delete a record in a remote table, where puts with null values are considered deletes.

> > Right now Samza SQL AvroRelConverter transforms the records with null values into null records. I think this was added to support `select * from` usecase when the input has null records, But ideally that should be supported through a mechanism where the entire record is passed as null from input to the output rather than add a current hack where we are flattening the record with null values into null record.
> 
> While converting a null avro record to rel record on line 90 (which is for the top level root record), we are explicitly setting each field in that record to null. The reverse is done here only for the root record for symmetry. Without the change that is reverted in the review, we cannot delete a record in a remote table, where puts with null values are considered deletes.

Can we use `__avroRecord__` to figure out whether the payload is null or not?
 
Looks like we are missing an end to end table test case for this scenario. Can we add a test case for this scenario?
Addressed all comments. Will pursue the yarn-client-upgrade separately.
@sborya please take a look at it

Addressed all comments. 
Thumbsup => the comment has been applied.

@dnishimura the equality check was intentional, because for some serdes (e.g. LI's AvroSpecificRecordSerde, JsonSerdeV2) two instances of the same class may not be equal since they only act on specific message types. However relaxing the check to check for type equality is fine for now.

Thanks for the review @prateekm !
In case you're waiting for the Travis-CI build to complete to merge this change, it's already completed: https://travis-ci.org/apache/samza/builds/496764468
I'm not sure why it still shows as pending in github.
Addressed all comments.
@shanthoosh Please merge if you don't need anything else for this PR.
@bharathkk Is this still relevant? If not, let's close this.
@Sanil15 Are you still planning to check this in?
@weisong44 Does this need to be merged in? If not, let's close the PR.
@bharathkk Looks like this still needs to be merged in. Can you please update when you have some spare time.
@pdu-mn1 Can you please close this PR? Thanks!
@rmatharu Let's get this checked in once you have some spare time.
@prateekm let me close this for now, I will pick it up later since this needs way more refactoring and documentation
@xinyuiscool Please take a look.
Thanks for the contribution @vwidin. cc @cameronlee314 for review.
Addressed all comments.
Thank you very much for the review, we will clean code according to your comments .

@xinyuiscool 
Please take a look when you have a chance.

@xinyuiscool not all the code that uses JOB.NAME, reads it of JobConfig#getName method and the same applies to JOB.ID

With this approach, we can easily log warnings and convey users to move to app.id and app.name. Also, I like the idea that you told, everything until JobRunner should use app.name/app.id and once the job gets submitted to Yarn, then job uses job.id. With this design, it is easier to make that happen in future when we get rid of job.id/job.name from user-defined configs and do multi-staging
@rmatharu We also want to move the JobModel to samza-api (where ContainerModel and TaskModel already are).
@rmatharu @mynameborat could you please take a look?
@rmatharu @mynameborat could you please take a look?

1. Can you add an e2e integration test for a `StreamApp` + async-api
2. Additionally, update our website-docs and add public code examples for usage

@cameronlee314 I'd prefer to not add new fields/semantics to IME if possible. I'm assuming you want to return the safe offset from LiKafka as the checkpoint offset? Any other alternatives to handle it?

> Looks good.
> General question around checkpoint offset vs offset:
> Are there other systems that will benefit with this separation? To me it seems this separation arises only in the case of Kafka specifically large message scenario.

We don't currently have any other concrete use cases for this, but I was thinking that this was still a general enough abstraction that it could apply to other systems if they needed to modify offsets.

> @cameronlee314 I'd prefer to not add new fields/semantics to IME if possible. I'm assuming you want to return the safe offset from LiKafka as the checkpoint offset? Any other alternatives to handle it?

That's correct.
I have sent over some alternative solutions separately.
For questions about changing IME, could we please use https://github.com/apache/samza/pull/940? This one just has the IME changes since it depends on those and I haven't checked in the other PR yet.
also adding @xinyuiscool in case he has additional feedback on the async-api
Addressed all comments.
This is no longer necessary. See SAMZA-2121 for more details.
Replaced by https://github.com/apache/samza/pull/947.
@vjagadish1989 thanks. Can you merge it?
@lhaiesp and @dxichen : please take a look!

> Kafka properties doesn't support replication.factor when creating topic, so change the way to override intermediate stream properties.

Just curious. Please correct me if I'm wrong.

1. Even kafka-topic creation shell-command supports a configuration like `replication.factor` when creating the topic(( kafka-streams supports configuration like replication.factor)). Is the change entails in the way how  kafka-client accepts this config(replication.factor) when creating the streams?
2. If kafka-client API does not support `replication.factor`, wouldn't it apply to other internal metadata-topics managed by samza viz `coordinator-stream`, `checkpoint` etc? Do we need to also change the way we create these internal metadata-topics.
LGTM, thanks!

@vjagadish1989
Can you take a look.

@dnishimura @cameronlee314 
Please take a look when you have a chance.

Is the timeout error shown in Travis-CI just a transient thing and not reproducible locally?
```testShouldCreateCoordinatorStream FAILED
    org.apache.samza.SamzaException: Creation of topic test-coordinator-stream failed.
        Caused by:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException```

@dnishimura No, I tried it locally multiple times but was not able to reproduce it. But that failure is orthogonal to this change. That test failure originates from the API: `KafkaSystemAdmin.createStream()`
@shanthoosh Please merge if you don't need anything else for this PR.
@weisong44  Can you help view this RB?  Thanks
@shanthoosh @jagadish-v0 @prateekm Please take a look
@cameronlee314 please have a look!
@prateekm Apologies for the delay in merging this in. I was side-tracked with save-points and standalone -prod issues with on-boarding new user.

Summary of 44d8c97
* Combined StandaloneIntegrationTestHarness and AbstractIntegrationTestHarness into IntegrationTestHarness. 
* Modified some more tests to use `adminClient` APIs and got rid of deprecated `zkUtils`
* Addressed Cameron's review comments.
* Fixed a bug around metric where in records-lag is not longer prefixed with the topic partition rather topic partitions are part of tags within the metric names.
@shanthoosh please take a look.
Thanks @shanthoosh. Please merge when you have some time.
It happened to me before. Not sure why. Thanks for merging it.

Addressed all comments. 
thumbsup => comment addressed.
